Package svs

Class ElectionController

java.lang.Object
svs.ElectionController
Direct Known Subclasses:
PluralityController, STVDroopController
public abstract class ElectionController
extends java.lang.Object
The class ElectionController is responsible for controlling both PluralityController and STVController elections and must be connected with MainWindow class. It provides every operation which both voting algorithms must perform in order to get correct results.

  • Constructor Details

    • ElectionController

      public ElectionController​(java.util.ArrayList<Ballot> ballots, Candidate[] candidates)
      This class globally stores ballots and candidates for using both the voting algorithms. Also it resetElection after every election run.
      Parameters:
      ballots - are an ArrayList of ballots from BallotFactory class.
      candidates - are number of candidate list from BallotFactory class.

  • Method Details

    • RunElection

      public final java.lang.String RunElection​(int num_seats) throws java.io.IOException
      This class is responsible for running the election for both voting algorithms and return final arraylist of winning and losing candidates. It also output the audit file in the form of text recording every intermediate operation including Distributing and Redistributing the ballots along with the final results.
      Parameters:
      num_seats - are number of seats provided by the user from MainWindow
      Returns:
      final sets of elected and non-elected candidates from PluralityController and STVDroopController class
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure when trying to write the audit file.

    • InterpretResults

      protected abstract java.lang.String InterpretResults​(Candidate[] results, int num_seats) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is responsible displaying results for both voting algorithm to the user interface.
      Parameters:
      results - an array of the candidates ordered from best to worst. What this means ('best' to 'worst') is contextual and depends on the election.
      num_seats - the number of seats used when determining the election.
      Returns:
      String of results
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there as an error while creating a file and writing to it

    • ElectionRoutine

      protected abstract Candidate[] ElectionRoutine​(int num_seats) throws java.io.IOException
      This method runs the election routine of the code for both voting algorithm
      Parameters:
      num_seats - are number of seats from the MainWindow class
      Returns:
      null
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure when trying to write the audit file.

    • invalidate_ballots

      protected abstract void invalidate_ballots()
      This method is responsible to invalidate the ballots that have less than half of the candidates ranked. The validated ballots are added to the validated_ballots array and invalidated ballots are added to the invalidated_ballots array so that a report of invalidated ballots can be created later.

    • election_report

      protected abstract void election_report​(int num_seats, Candidate[] candidates, Candidate[] winner_candidates) throws java.io.IOException
      This method creates a file called "Election_report.txt" This file includes the date, type of election , the candidates, the number of seats, and the winners.
      Parameters:
      num_seats - Number of seats in the election
      candidates - [], All the candidates
      winner_candidates - , Winner candidates in order
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException If there as an error while creating a file and writing to it

    • DistributeBallot

      protected final void DistributeBallot​(Ballot b, Candidate c) throws java.io.IOException
      This method can run distribute a given ballot to a designated candidate
      Parameters:
      b - is the input ballot which is to be distributed
      c - is the candidate where the ballot should go.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException if there is a failure when trying to write the audit file.

    • RedistributeBallot

      protected final void RedistributeBallot​(Ballot b, Candidate src, Candidate dest) throws java.io.IOException
      This method can redistribute a given ballots from a source candidate to the destination candidate for STV with Droop Quota Algorithm. It also records the messages of the redistribution operation performed inside.
      Parameters:
      b - is the given ballot
      src - is the source Candidate
      dest - is the destination candidate
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure when trying to write the audit file.

    • CustomAuditFileMsg

      protected final void CustomAuditFileMsg​(java.lang.String msg) throws java.io.IOException
      This method will populate the message from both Distribution and Redistribution methods.
      Parameters:
      msg - is the String msg from any operation
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure when trying to write the audit file.
